mn72:3.1.pli: “Kiṁ nu kho, bho gotama, ‘sassato loko, idameva saccaṁ moghamaññan’ti—
mn72:3.1.en: “Master Gotama, is [38;5;121mthis[0m your view: ‘[38;5;121mThe[0m world is eternal. [38;5;121mThis[0m is [38;5;121mthe[0m [38;5;121monly[0m [38;5;121mtruth[0m, other ideas are silly’?”

mn72:4.1.pli: “Kiṁ pana, bho gotama, ‘asassato loko, idameva saccaṁ moghamaññan’ti—
mn72:4.1.en: “[38;5;121mThe[0mn is [38;5;121mthis[0m your view: ‘[38;5;121mThe[0m world is not eternal. [38;5;121mThis[0m is [38;5;121mthe[0m [38;5;121monly[0m [38;5;121mtruth[0m, other ideas are silly’?”

mn72:5.1.pli: “Kiṁ nu kho, bho gotama, ‘antavā loko, idameva saccaṁ moghamaññan’ti—
mn72:5.1.en: “[38;5;121mThe[0mn is [38;5;121mthis[0m your view: ‘[38;5;121mThe[0m world is finite. [38;5;121mThis[0m is [38;5;121mthe[0m [38;5;121monly[0m [38;5;121mtruth[0m, other ideas are silly’?”

mn72:6.1.pli: “Kiṁ pana, bho gotama, ‘anantavā loko, idameva saccaṁ moghamaññan’ti—
mn72:6.1.en: “[38;5;121mThe[0mn is [38;5;121mthis[0m your view: ‘[38;5;121mThe[0m world is infinite. [38;5;121mThis[0m is [38;5;121mthe[0m [38;5;121monly[0m [38;5;121mtruth[0m, other ideas are silly’?”

mn72:7.1.pli: “Kiṁ nu kho, bho gotama, ‘taṁ jīvaṁ taṁ sarīraṁ, idameva saccaṁ moghamaññan’ti—
mn72:7.1.en: “[38;5;121mThe[0mn is [38;5;121mthis[0m your view: ‘[38;5;121mThe[0m soul and [38;5;121mthe[0m body are [38;5;121mthe[0m same thing. [38;5;121mThis[0m is [38;5;121mthe[0m [38;5;121monly[0m [38;5;121mtruth[0m, other ideas are silly’?”

mn72:8.1.pli: “Kiṁ pana, bho gotama, ‘aññaṁ jīvaṁ aññaṁ sarīraṁ, idameva saccaṁ moghamaññan’ti—
mn72:8.1.en: “[38;5;121mThe[0mn is [38;5;121mthis[0m your view: ‘[38;5;121mThe[0m soul and [38;5;121mthe[0m body are different things. [38;5;121mThis[0m is [38;5;121mthe[0m [38;5;121monly[0m [38;5;121mtruth[0m, other ideas are silly’?”

mn72:9.1.pli: “Kiṁ nu kho, bho gotama, ‘hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā, idameva saccaṁ moghamaññan’ti—
mn72:9.1.en: “[38;5;121mThe[0mn is [38;5;121mthis[0m your view: ‘A Realized One exists after death. [38;5;121mThis[0m is [38;5;121mthe[0m [38;5;121monly[0m [38;5;121mtruth[0m, other ideas are silly’?”

mn72:10.1.pli: “Kiṁ pana, bho gotama, ‘na hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā, idameva saccaṁ moghamaññan’ti—
mn72:10.1.en: “[38;5;121mThe[0mn is [38;5;121mthis[0m your view: ‘A Realized One doesn’t exist after death. [38;5;121mThis[0m is [38;5;121mthe[0m [38;5;121monly[0m [38;5;121mtruth[0m, other ideas are silly’?”

mn72:11.1.pli: “Kiṁ nu kho, bho gotama, ‘hoti ca na ca hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā, idameva saccaṁ moghamaññan’ti—
mn72:11.1.en: “[38;5;121mThe[0mn is [38;5;121mthis[0m your view: ‘A Realized One both exists and doesn’t exist after death. [38;5;121mThis[0m is [38;5;121mthe[0m [38;5;121monly[0m [38;5;121mtruth[0m, other ideas are silly’?”

mn72:12.1.pli: “Kiṁ pana, bho gotama, ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā, idameva saccaṁ moghamaññan’ti—
mn72:12.1.en: “[38;5;121mThe[0mn is [38;5;121mthis[0m your view: ‘A Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death. [38;5;121mThis[0m is [38;5;121mthe[0m [38;5;121monly[0m [38;5;121mtruth[0m, other ideas are silly’?”

dn29:30.2.pli: ‘kiṁ nu kho, āvuso, hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā, idameva saccaṁ moghamaññan’ti?
dn29:30.2.en: ‘Is [38;5;121mthis[0m your view: “A Realized One exists after death. [38;5;121mThis[0m is [38;5;121mthe[0m [38;5;121monly[0m [38;5;121mtruth[0m, other ideas are silly”?’

dn29:30.7.en: ‘[38;5;121mThe[0mn is [38;5;121mthis[0m your view: “A Realized One doesn’t exist after death. [38;5;121mThis[0m is [38;5;121mthe[0m [38;5;121monly[0m [38;5;121mtruth[0m, other ideas are silly”?’

dn29:34.8.pli: ‘sassato attā ca loko ca, idameva saccaṁ moghamaññan’ti.
dn29:34.8.en: ‘[38;5;121mThe[0m self and [38;5;121mthe[0m cosmos are eternal. [38;5;121mThis[0m is [38;5;121mthe[0m [38;5;121monly[0m [38;5;121mtruth[0m, other ideas are silly.’

dn29:34.24.pli: asayaṅkāraṁ aparaṅkāraṁ adhiccasamuppannaṁ sukhadukkhaṁ, idameva saccaṁ moghamaññan’ti.
dn29:34.24.en: or [38;5;121mthe[0my have arisen by chance, not made by oneself or another. [38;5;121mThis[0m is [38;5;121mthe[0m [38;5;121monly[0m [38;5;121mtruth[0m, other ideas are silly.’

dn29:37.12.pli: attā ucchijjati vinassati na hoti paraṁ maraṇā, idameva saccaṁ moghamaññan’ti.
dn29:37.12.en: or [38;5;121mthe[0m self is annihilated and destroyed when [38;5;121mthe[0m body breaks up, and doesn’t exist after death. [38;5;121mThis[0m is [38;5;121mthe[0m [38;5;121monly[0m [38;5;121mtruth[0m, other ideas are silly.’

an10.96:5.1.pli: “Kiṁ nu kho, bho, ‘sassato loko, idameva saccaṁ moghamaññan’ti—evaṁdiṭṭhi bhavan”ti?

sn45.174:1.3.pli: Abhijjhā kāyagantho, byāpādo kāyagantho, sīlabbataparāmāso kāyagantho, idaṁsaccābhiniveso kāyagantho—
sn45.174:1.3.en: [38;5;121mThe[0m personal ties to covetousness, ill will, misapprehension of precepts and observances, and [38;5;121mthe[0m insistence that [38;5;121mthis[0m is [38;5;121mthe[0m [38;5;121monly[0m [38;5;121mtruth[0m.

mn102:15.2.pli: ‘sassato attā ca loko ca, idameva saccaṁ moghamaññan’ti, tesaṁ vata aññatreva saddhāya aññatra ruciyā aññatra anussavā aññatra ākāraparivitakkā aññatra diṭṭhinijjhānakkhantiyā paccattaṁyeva ñāṇaṁ bhavissati parisuddhaṁ pariyodātanti—netaṁ ṭhānaṁ vijjati.
mn102:15.2.en: ‘[38;5;121mThe[0m self and [38;5;121mthe[0m cosmos are eternal. [38;5;121mThis[0m is [38;5;121mthe[0m [38;5;121monly[0m [38;5;121mtruth[0m, other ideas are silly.’ It’s simply not possible for [38;5;121mthe[0mm to have purified and clear personal knowledge of [38;5;121mthis[0m, apart from faith, preference, oral tradition, reasoned contemplation, or acceptance of a view after consideration.
